DOC.brief_summary: This pilot study determine 6 week home training program increase preferred step rate ( cadence ) recreational runner . Increase step rate correlate decreased stress lower limb joint runner . This potential decreasing overuse injury population . Research participant prefer cadence evaluate begin study . The athlete randomly assign two group . One group continue train without intervention group train cadence 10 % high preferred step rate . At end 6 week participant prefer cadence reevaluate use method pre-participation cadence determine . The investigator hypothesis prefer run cadence recreational runner follow intervention 5-10 % great prior intervention increase cadence maintain 6 month follow intervention .
DOC.criteria: Inclusion criterion : healthy male female runner 18 year age great run two time per week week year least 4 year cadence 85 strides/min less determined initial evaluation musculoskeletal injury illness would limit run last 6 month currently run least 15 mile week Exclusion criterion : baseline run cadence great 85 strides/min inability run cardiovascular disease great 2 cardiovascular risk factor peripheral vascular disease neurological disease musculoskeletal injury disease cause pain run
